body_html:
@fifothekid Is this build with or without MKL & MKLDNN?

Yes I did. I used this CMake command:

cmake .. -A x64 -T host=x64 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=D:/opencv/swigwin-3.0.12/swig.exe -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE="C:/Users/FiFo/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python36/python.exe" -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES="C:/Users/FiFo/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python36/libs/python36.lib" -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX2 -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_MORE_PYTHON_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_EXAMPLE=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_OPTIMIZE_FOR_NATIVE_ARCH=ON -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_MKL_SUPPORT=ON -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_MKLDNN_SUPPORT=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB=OFF

I'll try building again today
Rebuilding on Windows takes soooooooooo much time
It seems like on Linux with Bazel only the addition files are built, not everything!
I mean, for building the Python project I assume about 10% more files need to be built, still the building process takes 90+ minutes, and it seems like it almost rebuilds everything

body:
> @fifothekid Is this build with or without MKL & MKLDNN?

Yes I did. I used this CMake command:

`cmake .. -A x64 -T host=x64 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DSWIG_EXECUTABLE=D:/opencv/swigwin-3.0.12/swig.exe -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE="C:/Users/FiFo/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python36/python.exe" -DPYTHON_LIBRARIES="C:/Users/FiFo/AppData/Local/Programs/Python/Python36/libs/python36.lib" -Dtensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS=/arch:AVX2 -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_MORE_PYTHON_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_EXAMPLE=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_CC_TESTS=OFF -Dtensorflow_OPTIMIZE_FOR_NATIVE_ARCH=ON -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_MKL_SUPPORT=ON -Dtensorflow_ENABLE_MKLDNN_SUPPORT=ON -Dtensorflow_BUILD_SHARED_LIB=OFF`

I'll try building again today
Rebuilding on Windows takes soooooooooo much time
It seems like on Linux with Bazel only the addition files are built, not everything!
I mean, for building the Python project I assume about 10% more files need to be built, still the building process takes 90+ minutes, and it seems like it almost rebuilds everything
